p: The microbiological study suggested different bacterial colonies were absent in the samples of marigold leaf paste and turmeric paste-treated groups following D 1. However, the bacterial colonies existed in the culture of samples of the normal saline-treated group until D 3. Moreover, through Gram stain, cultured samples proved the existence of Staphylococcus spp. and E. coli. The bacteria gradually reduced their susceptibility to elimination by the host immune response and antibiotics. Different types of bacteria, such as Staphylococcus spp., hemolytic Streptococci, and Pseudomonas spp . are mostly found in surgical wounds [ 16]. We have discovered the splendid antibacterial activity of both the marigold leaf paste and turmeric paste in wound healing in sheep, which is analogous to the findings of Nandita et al. [ 24] and Dasgupta et al. [ 25]. They showed the comparative antibacterial action of marigold leaves extracts against E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus, and Salmonella typhimurium.
